Events that occurred on 6 September.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1939 - Voice actor Gordon Reid is born.
1949 - Author Robert Foster is born.
1970 – The first Mythcon is held at Harvey Mudd College in Claremont, California.
1971 - Mythcon 2 in Santa Barbara, California.
1973 - A requiem Mass for J.R.R. Tolkien is held in the Church of St Anthony of Padua in Headington, Oxford. Father Robert Murray assists.
1975 - Oxonmoot 1975 at the Welsh Poney, Oxford.
1992 - The first part of the 1992 radio series of The Adventures of Tom Bombadil is aired on BBC Radio 5.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
T.A. 3019:
Under the Mountains of Moria, Celeborn and Galadriel, Gandalf and the four Hobbits halt and tarry for several days.[1]

content.title: References
content.content: ↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings, Appendix B, "The Chief Days from the Fall of Barad-dûr to the End of the Third Age"
